intro.title: Cognitive Defusion
description: Your thoughts are not facts. They are just noise created by your mind.
Shall we take a step back from your thoughts? We'll practice letting them pass by without holding on tight.
Let's reduce the sound of the false alarm called anxiety and face the real reality.
intro.contentTitle: The Process of Reducing the Power of Thoughts
intro.contentDescription: Practice recognizing thoughts as mere 'words' passing by, not mistaking them for reality.
steps: 1. Write a sentence: Write down the thoughts that make you anxious in sentences.
2. Separate thoughts: Drag and select the parts of the sentence that are 'my thoughts', not facts.
3. Let go: Watch the selected thoughts become transparent and disappear, leaving only objective facts.
intro.tip: Tip: Thoughts are like 'false alarms' sent by the brain. Don't react to the sound, just notice that a sound is heard.

title: What thoughts are
floating in your mind right now?
step1.description: Write down what you hear in your mind without judgment. It's okay if it's long, and even a trivial sentence is fine.

title: Where in this sentence
are my 'thoughts'?
step2.description: Try dragging only the interpretation or judgment parts.

title: The foam of thoughts has cleared,
only facts remain.
result.description: Like the sentence that became transparent, thoughts are just thoughts. You can now take a breath on the solid ground of facts.
